results.title: Putting the atom to work
results.brief_description: Atomic power in medicine, food preservation, and generation of electric power, future uses, and the dangers of nuclear energy. Calder Hall and Chapel Cross nuclear power stations. Britain’s first nuclear power programme consists of a number of stations. In 1962 the first of these started operating at Berkeley. A simple account of applied nuclear fission in Britain, showing the operation of nuclear power stations and production of radioactive isotopes.

results.title: Protect your back
results.creator_credit: Jane Nicholls and Yoralla Society of Victoria
results.brief_description: Demonstrates safe lifting practices for families, friends and service providers of people with disabilities in community based environments. Overviews how the back works, risk factors and correct lifting practices. Provides guidelines for when the person being asisted can help or cannot communicate and assistance techniques including seating adjustment, discussing the lift, adjusting position in bed, transferring, assisted walking and lifting in a team.

results.title: Proof of power
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Ford Motor Company, this film deals with the scientific measurement of tractor power, and its application in primary production. The American sequence is included by courtesy of the University of Nebraska, USA.

results.title: Programming controlling producing
results.brief_description: Studies the Index factories in West Germany, and the machines they make. Their designs are shown, and the major components of their Automatic engines are examined.

results.title: Profiles of elementary physical education
results.brief_description: Methods in teaching physical education and guiding class activities for kindergarten through elementary grades. Starting with kindergarten and carrying through the elementary grades this film stresses the successful methods used in the teaching of physical education. It urges careful organisation and presents many ideas for the guidance of class activities. Based on the physical education program of Cleveland schools, this film is invaluable to the beginning as well as to the experienced teacher of physical education in any elementary school system.

results.title: Problems to be solved
results.brief_description: A restrained dramatic presentation of the problems of personal relationships and private worries in the office. A cleaner find mute evidence of the past day’s tensions as she moves around each desk. The office boy feels he is learning nothing; a clerk is extremely tense; a young mother worried about the child who must be left alone in the house; an executive is continually short-tempered and panicky; the manger has too full a timetable to do more than notice the existence of these problems.

results.title: Principles of routine composition
results.creator_credit: Mary Ann Reeves and Coaching Association of Canada
results.brief_description: Step by step instruction on how to compose a routine for synchronised swimming. Counting out music, land drills, coaching techniques, putting ideas together and practical methods are all considered.

results.title: Princess Margaret visits Jamaica
results.creator_credit: Martin Rennolls and Jamaica Film Unit
results.brief_description: A record of the visit made to Jamaica by HRH Princess Margaret during her tour of the West Indies in 1955. Orchestral music by the Jamaica Military Band.
